description: Web tool that steps through SQL SELECT query evaluation, highlighting the active clause and showing intermediate results. Used to teach how queries execute; supports LMS/LTI integration.
ACOS content package that delivers Parsons problems (code reordering puzzles). Provides shared JS components and deployment scaffolding for building and serving Parsons-style programming exercises.
JavaScript library for creating step-by-step program execution visualizations. Offers reusable operations and extensibility for language-specific visual execution content.
Interactive worked-example system for learning code construction. Breaks solutions into subgoal steps with on-demand explanations and checks, supporting self-paced study of programming patterns.
Parameterized Java quiz engine that generates variants, executes reference code to compute correct answers, checks responses, and logs performance for practice and adaptive support.
Parameterized Python quiz tool focused on code behavior/semantics. Generates instances, runs code to derive answers, grades responses, and records results for targeted practice.
Annotated example viewer for programming code. Learners inspect instructor comments line-by-line, opening explanations as needed to support comprehension and example-based learning.
Repository of WebEx-style annotated programming examples packaged for reuse (often via ACOS). Provides curated example sets across languages for embedding into courses or adaptive platforms.
